Dear Jims
I am enclosing a statement of expenses incurred in the
preparation of the News-Letter which I hope can be defrayed
from the Kellogg funds (except for the t10.50 typing bill
from Miss Wipperman this was incurred prior to the preparation
of the copy for the January 1952 issue).
Bills are enclosed for the money due Cranes, lows State
College, and the University of Minnesota. Receipts for the
stamps I purchased and for telephone calls and telegrsas for
which I now seek reimbursement are also enclosed.
This matter, I suppose could be handled in either of two
wfjyss fou could have five separate checks prepared for mailing
to the institutions or people to whom we owe money, or you
could send me & check for the total (199.30) and I would
deposit It and ay e;ch of these people myself.
I am sending this by registered mail since this is the
only set of bills and receipts I have for these accounts.
lours sincere^.
Burton Peulu I
Secretary and Publications editor
